Scip. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43618.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: versus, <hi rend="ital">a verse consisting of six feet</hi> (usu. iambics), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1, prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, prol. 2</bibl>.—More freq. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:55:184" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 55, 184</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56, 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:140 al" default="NO">9, 4, 140 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
senator: <entryFree id="n43619" type="main" key="se^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>senex</etym>, <sense id="n43619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a senator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a member of the Roman Senate</hi>, a body consisting originally of one hundred eminent citizens, selected by Romulus for their age, wisdom, and experience, out of the noblest <cb n="SENA" /> families, to be his council in the government. When the Sabines were incorporated with Rome, the number was doubled; and Tarquin the Elder raised it to three hundred; Sulla to four hundred; Julius Cæsar to nine hundred, while Augustus reduced it to six hundred. Originally, patricians alone were eligible to seats in the Senate; but later additions were made from the Knights (v. senatus). The senators were nominated by the kings; and, after they were expelled, by the consuls and dictators. Later, the censors revised the roll of senators every lustrum, excluding members regarded as unworthy. (On the powers of the Senate, the privileges, dress, etc., of its members, v. Dict. of Antiq. s. v. Senatus.) —<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (senatori) jussa tria sunt: ut assit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 49, 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 47, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:43" default="NO">11, 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 110 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 3 al.</bibl>—Out of Rome, of the Nervii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28</bibl>.—Of the Rhodians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 48</bibl>.—Of the Macedonians ( = <foreign lang="greek">su)nedroi</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 32</bibl> et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the Persians,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 6, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
senatorius: <entryFree id="n43620" type="main" key="se^na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>senator</etym>, <sense id="n43620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a senator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senatorial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus aetas a senatorio gradu longe abesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 21, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 18, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 62, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:104:1" default="NO" valid="yes">104, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsellia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Corn. 1, p. 449</bibl></cit> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <trans><tr>the deliberations of the Senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>speeches made in the Senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">album,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 8, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam civile, tam senatorium, quam illud, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:2:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 2, 7</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a senator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines nobiles cum paucis senatoriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Rep. Ord. 2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Rep. Ord. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> p. 277 Gerl.</sense></entryFree>
senatrix: <entryFree id="n43621" type="main" key="se^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnātrix</orth>, <itype>trīcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female senator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 638</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
senatus: <entryFree id="n43622" type="main" key="se^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n43622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> senati, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 5</bibl>; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 484, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 5, 19</bibl>; also cited ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 116</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes">53, 1</bibl>. acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 484, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 10</bibl> P.; Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 712</bibl> P.; id. Fragm. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 28</bibl>; also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 4</bibl>, acc. to the pr. man. of the Cod. Medic.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 27</bibl>.—Another form of the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> senatuis, C. Fann. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 116</bibl> P.; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 484, 19</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">as it seems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 484:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 484, 19</bibl></cit>, yet the passage itself is wanting.—In old orthog. SENATVOS, S. C. de Bacch.; <case>dat.</case> senato, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 27</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>senex; like <foreign lang="greek">gerousi/a</foreign> from <foreign lang="greek">ge/rwn</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:28:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 28, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 19</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">the council of the elders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Senate</hi>, the supreme council in Rome, concerning whose origin, constitution, powers, etc., v. senator; cf. Momms. Hist. of Rome, 1, 113 sqq.; 1, 406 sqq. Am. ed.; Becker, Antiq. 2, 1, p. 339 sq.; 2, 2, p. 385 sq.; 2, 3, p. 210 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">and the authors there cited: quae (consilium, ratio, sententia) nisi essent in senibus, non summum consilium majores nostri appellassent senatum. Apud Lacedaemonios quidem ii, qui amplissimum magistratum gerunt, ut sunt sic etiam nominantur senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romuli senatus, qui constabat ex optimatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 12, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Majores nostri) senatum rei publicae custodem collo caverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus rem pu blicam tenuit, ut pleraque senatūs auctori tate gererentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 32, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut potentia senatus atque auctoritas minueretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum potestas in populo, auctoritas in senatu sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:12:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec per senatum solvi hac lege possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:22:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 22, 33</bibl></cit>.—Freq. in the phrase: senatus populusque Romanus (often written S. P. Q. R.), <hi rend="ital">the Senate and people of Rome</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">the State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the republic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 2, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">very rarely in reverse order: populus et senatus Romanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani senatusque verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 37, 7</bibl>; Vitr. praef. 1, 1: senatus (senati, senatuis, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>) consultum, <hi rend="ital">a decree of the Senate</hi> (v. <itype>consulo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> III.); senatūs auctoritas, the same (v. auctoritas, 4.): censuit senatus, <hi rend="ital">the Senate resolved;</hi> v. censeo, 3. b. (cf. also decerno, I. A., and decretum, s. v. decerno <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">senatum convocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 23, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 12</bibl>: senatus <pb n="1669" /> <cb n="SENE" /> est continuo convocatus frequensque convenit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus frequens vocatu Drusi in curiam venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocare senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cito cogere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo die non fuit senatus neque postero,</quote> <trans><tr>no session of the Senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25</bibl></cit>, a, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem die Tyriis (legatis) est senatus datus frequens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gave audience</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dare senatum (legatis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 6</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">senatu dimisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa ejus (Catonis) et in senatu et in foro vel provisa prudenter vel acta constanter ferebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>in the meetings of the Senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Catilina) etiam in senatum venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: ad senatum adduci, in senatu poni, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad senatum in Capitolio stare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 137</bibl></cit>: in senatu sedere, <hi rend="ital">to sit among the senators</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the senatorial seats</hi> (in the theatre), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in orchestram senatumque descendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senatum venire,</quote> <trans><tr>to become a senator</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de senatu cooptando,</quote> <trans><tr>nominating</tr>, <tr>electing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:49:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49, § 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de senatu movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:43:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 43, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatu movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 1</bibl></cit> Dietsch; and: <cit><quote lang="la">senatu emovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex or de senatu eicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 12, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 42, 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">48, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 15 al.</bibl> (v. 1. lego and eicio): seminarium senatus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the order of Knights</hi>, from which new senators were elected, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:61:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 61, 5</bibl>.—Also of the <hi rend="ital">Senate</hi> of other nations: senatus (Gaditanus), Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeduorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venetorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaeorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43622.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a council</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">consultation</hi> (mostly ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de re argentariā senatum convocare in corde consiliarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi senatum consili in cor convocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deūm,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 582</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
senatusconsultum: <entryFree id="n43623" type="main" key="se^na_tusconsultum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnātusconsultum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. <itype>consulo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> III.</entryFree>
seneca: <entryFree id="n43624" type="main" key="Se^ne^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕnĕca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname</hi> (cognomen) <hi rend="ital">in the</hi> gens Annaea. The most famous are, </sense><sense id="n43624.1" n="I" level="1"> M. Annaeus Seneca, <hi rend="ital">a native of Corduba</hi> (in Hispania Baetica), <hi rend="ital">a celebrated rhetorician in the time of Augustus and Tiberius</hi>, whose writings (Controversiae and Suasoriae) are now extant only in fragments, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:98" default="NO">9, 2, 98</bibl>; v. Teuffel, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 264.—</sense><sense id="n43624.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">His son</hi>, L. Annaeus Seneca, <hi rend="ital">a Stoic philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instructor of Nero;</hi> of whom are extant, in prose, philosophical treatises, letters, and a satire upon the Emperor Claudius (Apocolocyntosis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 125</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in poetry eight tragedies, mostly founded on Greek originals which are still preserved, besides a few epigrams. The poetical works have been by many scholars referred to a later age, but they are now commonly accepted as authentic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 231</bibl>; v. Teuffel, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 282 sqq.</sense></entryFree>
senecio: <entryFree id="n43625" type="main" key="se^ne^ci^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnĕcĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>senex</etym>, <sense id="n43625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old man</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 618</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43626" type="main" key="Se^ne^ci^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕnĕcĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 56</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 11, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43627" type="main" key="se^ne^ci^o3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnĕcĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> erigeron, <hi rend="ital">groundsel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 106, § 167</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
senecta: <entryFree id="n43628" type="main" key="se^necta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnecta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. senectus, II.</entryFree>
senectus: <entryFree id="n43629" type="main" key="se^nectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>senex</etym>, <sense id="n43629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very old.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43629.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (rare, and mostly anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">senecta aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:886" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 886</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:896" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 896</bibl>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 165</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">membris exire senectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 772</bibl></cit>: corpus, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 869</bibl> (H. 4, 63 Dietsch): aetas, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 165</bibl> (H. inc. l<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 115</bibl> Dietsch).—</sense><sense id="n43629.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕ-necta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">old age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extreme age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senility</hi> (freq., though mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.; cf. 2. senectus). </sense><sense id="n43629.3" n="A" level="2"> In abstr.: prospiciendum ergo in senectā: nunc adulescentia est, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 492, 23</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:55:184" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 55, 184</bibl> (Trag. v. 393 Vahl.; v. Vahl. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> ad h. 1.); Plaut. Most. <cb n="SENE" /> 1, 3, 60 (opp. aetatula); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 29</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 31</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 8, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1256</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 4, 2</bibl>; 28, 16, 12; 38, 53, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:31" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:42" default="NO">1, 8, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:40 al" default="NO">1, 10, 40 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13" default="NO">2, 13</bibl> (3, 5), 47; 3, 5 (4, 4), 24; 3, 19 (4, 18), 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 186</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:114 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 114 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 347</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 500</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 675 et saep. al.: in senectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">so in prose,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:116" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 32, 50, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:117" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 27, 51, § 117</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 41</bibl>; 4, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 13, 33; 14, 65 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:70:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 70, 18 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43629.4" n="B" level="2"> In the elder Pliny, concr. ( = 2. senectus, II.), <hi rend="ital">the old skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slough</hi> of a serpent, cast off annually: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes senectam exuendo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 95, § 254</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:174" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11, 48, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:69" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 8, 22, § 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43629.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An old man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:6" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:178" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43630" type="main" key="se^nectu_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnectūs</orth>, <itype>ūtis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>senex</etym>. <sense id="n43630.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Old age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extreme age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senility</hi> (freq. and class.; only in <number>sing.</number>): adulescentia (tua) senectuti dedecoramentum (fuit), senectus rei publicae flagitium, C. Gracch. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 21, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi qui adulescentiam florem aetatis, senectutem occasum vitae velit definire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:7:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in Catone Majore, qui est scriptus ad te de senectute ... ut tum ad senem senex de senectute, sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 1</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Aufidius, qui vixit ad summam senectutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:179" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 48, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset summā senectute et perditā valetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confecti homines senectute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ted optestor per senectutem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi fovebo senectutem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:44 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 44 al.</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 8, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 414</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 255</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:108:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 108, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 416</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 304</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 440</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 343</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:156" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 40</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 40: dum virent genua, Et decet, obductā solvatur fronte senectus,</quote> <trans><tr>the moroseness of old age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vos tam foeda senectus corripuit, fregitque animos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:283" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 283</bibl></cit>.—Of style; only trop., and hence with <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsa oratio jam nostra canesceret haberetque suam quandam maturitatem et quasi senectutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plena litteratae senectutis oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 265</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. things (for vetustas; only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vos (tabellae) cariosa senectus Rodat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini veteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:214" default="NO">13, 214</bibl>.— Prov.: aquilae senectus, v. aquila.—</sense><sense id="n43630.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43630.2" n="1" level="3"> Personified, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of old age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Old Age</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis Senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 275</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43630.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Old age</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">old men</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus semper agens aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 48</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequari adulescentes senectae suae impatienter indoluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43630.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Gray hairs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus geminis canebat sparsa senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 416</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43630.5" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The old skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slough</hi>, cast off yearly by serpents and other animals: <cit><quote lang="la">Theophrastus auctor est, anguis modo et stelliones senectutem exuere eamque protinus devorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 31, 49, § 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:95" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 30, 50, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:57" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 7, 19, § 57</bibl>; 30, 9, 23, § 81; cf. senecta, supra, II. B.</sense></entryFree>
senensis: <entryFree id="n43631" type="main" key="Se_nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Sena.</entryFree>
seneo: <entryFree id="n43632" type="main" key="se^neo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕneo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>v. senex</etym>. <sense id="n43632.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be old</hi> (very rare; perh. only in the foll. examples): quamquam aetas senet, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 887</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43632.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>: corpus meum tali maerore, errore, macore senet, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 137, 1</bibl>; (with languere) Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 887</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
senesco: <entryFree id="n43633" type="main" key="se^nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnesco</orth>, <itype>nŭi, 3</itype> (<sense id="n43633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gerundive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senescendi homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 11</bibl></cit> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [seneo], <hi rend="ital">to grow old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become aged; to grow hoary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43633.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ita sensim aetas senescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora labuntur tacitisque senescimus annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:771" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 771</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senescente jam Graeciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solve senescentem mature equum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores senescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 27, 50, § 116</bibl></cit>: Solon significat se cottidie aliquid addiscentem senescere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7, 14</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avus (Augusti) tranquillissime senuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego senui et progressioris aetatis sum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Josne, 23, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">gerundive</hi>: longissimum spatium senescendorum hominum id (seclum) putarant,<cb n="SENE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 11</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n43633.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43633.3" n="A" level="2"> For the usual consenescere, <hi rend="ital">to grow old</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gray</hi> in an occupation, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">to linger too long</hi> over it: <cit><quote lang="la">inani circa voces studio senescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 18.—</sense><sense id="n43633.4" n="B" level="2"> (Causa pro effectu.) <hi rend="ital">To decay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi> in strength; <hi rend="ital">to grow weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">powerless; to waste away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decline</hi>, etc. (the prevailing signif. of the word in prose and poetry; cf. consenesco; while inveterasco is to grow better by age). </sense><sense id="n43633.5" n="1" level="3"> Of living subjects (a favorite expression of Livy; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not in Cic., but cf. consenesco, II. 2.): Hannibalem jam et famā senescere et viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otio senescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse cum aegro senescendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis hominibusque accusandis senescere,</quote> <trans><tr>to pine away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 43</bibl></cit> Drak.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amore senescit habendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socordiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:13:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 13, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne (agni) desiderio senescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of doves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod antiquatur et senescit prope interitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43633.6" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam faciunda in agris potius crescente lunā quam senescente,</quote> <trans><tr>in the waning of the moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:37:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 37, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">luna (opp. crescens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores hiemali tempore cum lunā simul senescentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc pleno orbe, nunc senescente (al. senescentem) exiguo cornu fulgere lunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuā messe senescit ager,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes exhausted</tr>, <tr>worn out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 259</bibl></cit>: uniones, i. e. <hi rend="ital">grow pale</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dim</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 115</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus in salem,</quote> <trans><tr>grows salt with age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 242</bibl></cit>: coma, <hi rend="ital">falls out</hi>, Domit. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: monumenta virūm, <hi rend="ital">decay</hi> (with delapsa), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 312</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis senescens,</quote> <trans><tr>drawing to an end</tr>, <tr>closing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 10</bibl></cit> Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>.—Of abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorum laus senescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut laus senescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senescere civitatem otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia orta occidunt et aucta senescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. Fabri ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 10</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">somnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 3:22, p. 235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. Fragm. 3, 22, p. 235</bibl></cit> Gerl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalis vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 24</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia (opp. maturescente virtute),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna (opp. florere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 594</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
senex: <entryFree id="n43634" type="main" key="se^nex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnex</orth>, <itype>sĕnis</itype> (<case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case> of the <sense id="n43634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi> and of the <hi rend="ital">neutr. sing.</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> do not occur; orig. <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> sĕnicis, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 724</bibl> P.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. sana-s, old; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/nos, e(/nh,</foreign> old; cf.: senium, senesco, senatus, senilis, senectus, Seneca</etym> (<hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> senior), <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advanced in years;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an aged person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an old man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old woman</hi> (from the latter half of the fortieth year onward; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> the passages from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:28:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 28, 1</bibl>, and from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30</bibl>; cf.: annosus, longaevus, vetulus). </sense><sense id="n43634.1" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(paterfamilias) vendat boves vetulos, plostrum vetus, ferramenta vetera, servum senem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic est vetus, vietus, veternosus senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: nam vere pusus tu, tua amica senex, Papin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 28</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe senex miles, turpe senilis amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:159" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cygni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 30, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchus (i. e. vinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same, auctumni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 58, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Damascena (pruna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:18:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 18, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">admodum senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo est tam senex qui se annum non putet posse vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Nostra tuum senibus loqueretur pagina seclis,</quote> <trans><tr>in later ages</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 40</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandior seniorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:955" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 955</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato, quo erat nemo fere senior temporibus illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vis senior est quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora seniora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:58:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 58, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:94:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 94, 2</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with aetate: <cit><quote lang="la">Sophocles, aetate jam senior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis adulescentibus seniores in agendo facti praecipere solebant, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senior ut ita dicam, quam illa aetas ferebat, oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>more mature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 43, 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43634.2" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tum ad senem senex de senectute, sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: quos ait Caccilius comicos stul <pb n="1670" /> <cb n="SENI" /> tos senes, etc. ... ut petulantia magis est adulescentium quam senum ... sic ista senilis stultitia senum levium est ... Appius et caecus et senex, etc. ... senem, in quo est adulescentis aliquid, probo, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:36 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 36 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senem in patriam revertentem, unde puer profectus sum (the words of Hannibal, who was not yet fifty years of age),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixta senum ac juvenum densentur funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec recinunt juvenes dictata senesque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeque neglectum pueris senibusque nocebit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter aevo functus senex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Nestor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tun' capite cano amas, senex nequissime?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo senex nequior nullus vivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te sene omnium senem neminem esse ignaviorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc tot mala ferre senem,</quote> <trans><tr>this old woman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:82" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:349" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 349</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:149" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 149</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an elder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elderly person;</hi> sometimes (esp. in the poets) also for senex, <hi rend="ital">an aged person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilius sanescit puer vel adulescens quam senior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis Forte coheredum senior male tussiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix ea fatus erat senior (i. e. Anchises),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 692</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">= senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 645</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 702</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 646</bibl>; 12, 182; 12, 540; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:515" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 515</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:94" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 2, 383 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Servius Tullius) seniores a junioribus divisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: C. Tubero in Historiarum primo scripsit, Servium Tullium ... eos (milites) ab anno septimo decimo ad annum quadragesimum sextum juniores, supraque eum annum seniores appellasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:28:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriae juniorum seniorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriae seniorum simply, for seniores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae fuit consulibus et senioribus Patrum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulares ac seniores (opp. juniores Patrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium seniorum, matrum familiae, virginum precibus et fletu excitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapienter, ut senior, suaserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juniores a senioribus consilium petiverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ... laeti audiere juvenes, ingrata senioribus erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc inter juniores senesque orta contentio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.—In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">an elder in the synagogue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">church</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl> Johan. 1.</sense></entryFree>
seni: <entryFree id="n43635" type="main" key="se_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n43635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> senūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:49:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 49, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">num. distrib.</hi> [sex]. </sense><sense id="n43635.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">six each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in sex partes divisus exercitus Romanus senis horis in orbem succederet proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senos viros singuli currus vehebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tribuni militum seni deni (by many written in one word, senideni) in quattuor legiones crearentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sena dena (or senadena) stipendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senūm pedum crassitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri annorum senūm septenūmque denūm,</quote> <trans><tr>sixteen and seventeen years old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:49:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49, § 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43635.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for sex, <hi rend="ital">six</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradiderat natalibus actis Bis puerum senis,</quote> <trans><tr>past his twelfth birthday</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sena vellera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:429" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hexameter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus (of the senarius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudo ejus ne minus pedum senūm denūm (or senumdenum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
seniae: <entryFree id="n43636" type="main" key="Seniae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Seniae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <sense id="n43636.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">balneae,</quote> <trans><tr>the name of a public bath at Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 25, 62</bibl></cit> (this the correct read., not Xeniae).</sense></entryFree>
senica: <entryFree id="n43637" type="main" key="se^ni^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> or <gen>f.</gen> <etym>senicus; whence senex</etym>, <sense id="n43637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an aged person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an old man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old woman</hi>, only Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 20</bibl>, and 21.</sense></entryFree>
seniculus: <entryFree id="n43638" type="main" key="se^ni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>senex</etym>, <sense id="n43638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little old man</hi>, only <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
senideni: <entryFree id="n43639" type="main" key="se_ni_de_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēnīdēni</orth>, v. seni.</entryFree>
seniensis: <entryFree id="n43640" type="main" key="Se_ni^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēnĭensis</orth> (Colonia), <sense id="n43640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Siena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 45</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēnĭenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sena</hi>, Tac. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
senilis: <entryFree id="n43641" type="main" key="se^ni_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>senex</etym>, <sense id="n43641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to old people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senile</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Tages puerili specie dicitur visus, sed senili fuisse prudentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 23, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">partes (opp. viriles),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senile aliquid (opp. adulescentis aliquid),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:528" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:58" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua incurva,</quote> <trans><tr>of an old man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:35:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 35, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 66</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: hiems (as the last, latest <cb n="SENS" /> season of the year), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:212" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 212</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adoptio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senile illud facinus,</quote> <trans><tr>that wicked old woman</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 148, 9</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnīlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">after the manner of an old person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
senio: <entryFree id="n43642" type="main" key="se_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēnĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>seni</etym>, <sense id="n43642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number six</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sice</hi> upon dice: talis jactatis, ut quisque canem aut senionem miserat, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:48" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:1:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
senior: <entryFree id="n43643" type="main" key="se^ni^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnĭor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, v. senex.</entryFree>
senipes: <entryFree id="n43644" type="main" key="se_ni^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēnĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">six-footed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senarian</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">stilus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
senium: <entryFree id="n43645" type="main" key="se^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>seneo, II.</etym>. <sense id="n43645.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the feebleness of age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debility</hi> (cf. senectus; class.): tardigemulo senio oppressum, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus perfectum, quod omni morbo seniove careret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; (with aegritudo) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 27</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">senio debilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, epil. 16: <cit><quote lang="la">senio vel aliquā corporis labe insignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senio confectos gladiatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senium Galbae et juventa Othonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvata senio membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessus senio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxa senio mens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">torpor mentis ac senium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:26:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 26, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:14" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita se ipse (mundus) consumptione et senio alebat sui,</quote> <trans><tr>by its own consumption and decay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>waning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentae velut tabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senium repellere templis,</quote> <trans><tr>decay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:20" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senium defendere famae,</quote> <trans><tr>the growing old</tr>, <tr>passing away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:318" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passus est leges istas situ atque senio emori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43645.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43645.2" n="A" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">an old man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old fellow</hi> (very rare; anteclass. as an epithet of abuse): senex ad aetatem refertur, senium ad convicium. Sic Lucilius ait: At quidem te senium atque insulse sophista, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 11</bibl>. And on account of its personal signif. with a <hi rend="ital">masc. pron.</hi>: ut illum di deaeque senium perdant, qui hodie me remoratus est, Ter. l. l. (cf. scortum, II. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).—Once in Silius, without an odious access. signif., for senex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:467" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 467</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43645.3" n="B" level="2"> (Effectus pro causā.) <hi rend="ital">Peevishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moroseness; vexation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chagrin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortification; grief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affliction</hi> produced by decay (syn.: maeror, aegritudo, etc.; class.): mors amici subigit, quae mihi est senium multo acerrimum, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae res mihi dividiae et senio sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id illi senio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: odio ac senio mihi nuptiae, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luget senatus, maeret equester ordo, tota civitas confecta senio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senio et maerore consumptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:16" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">surge et inhumanae senium depone Camenae,</quote> <trans><tr>peevishness</tr>, <tr>moroseness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">triste morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 917" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 917</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en pallor seniumque!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: quot pestes, senia et jurgia emigrarunt, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 18</bibl>.!*? The words ille senius, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 154</bibl>, are doubtless corrupt; v. Orell. and Ellendt ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
seno: <entryFree id="n43646" type="main" key="Se_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēno</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. Senones.</entryFree>
senones: <entryFree id="n43647" type="main" key="Se^no^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕnŏnes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēnōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*se/nones</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*sh/nwnes</foreign>. <sense id="n43647.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people in</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, <hi rend="ital">whose chief city was</hi> Agendicum, now <hi rend="ital">Sens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2</bibl> sq.; 6, 44; 7, 4 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:234" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 234</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:160" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 7</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕno</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Senones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Drappeten Senonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:30" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43647.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">sprung from the above</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 116</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕnŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Senones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sensa: <entryFree id="n43648" type="main" key="sensa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sensa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. sentio <sense id="n43648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
